Row.Text: Paradrop 2
May paradrop up to 20 tiles away.
May paradrop up to 20 tiles away.
Battle Network
+20% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when adjacent to another friendly unit.
+20% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when adjacent to another friendly unit.
Skynet Uplink
+10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.
+10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.
Nanoswarm
Heals friendly units within two tiles for 10 HP each turn, and damages enemy units within two tiles for 10 HP each turn.
Heals friendly units within two tiles for 10 HP each turn, and damages enemy units within two tiles for 10 HP each turn.
Command Nexus
Reduces the combat strength of enemy units within two tiles by 20%.
Reduces the combat strength of enemy units within two tiles by 20%.
Mutation
When this unit is killed by an enemy, adjacent enemy units with 50% or less HP may become Barbarians.
When this unit is killed by an enemy, adjacent enemy units with 50% or less HP may become Barbarians.
Gengineered
Permits choice of gengineered promotions.
Permits choice of gengineered promotions.
Adrenal Glands
+20% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength in rough terrain.
+20% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength in rough terrain.
Predatorial Instinct
+30% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength in Forest and Jungle terrain.
+30% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength in Forest and Jungle terrain.
Photomorphic Camouflage
Invisible unless adjacent to an enemy unit.
Invisible unless adjacent to an enemy unit.
Enhanced Reflexes
33% bonus against ranged attacks.
33% bonus against ranged attacks.
Enhanced Vision
+1 Sight Range.
+1 Sight Range.
Enhanced Musculature
+1 Movement and is not affected by movement penalties from terrain.
+1 Movement and is not affected by movement penalties from terrain.
Biomods
Permits choice of biomod promotions.
Permits choice of biomod promotions.
Toxin Mod
When this unit dies, it deals 10 damage to adjacent enemy units.
When this unit dies, it deals 10 damage to adjacent enemy units.
Boost Mod
When this unit starts the turn below 50% health, it gains a temporary increase to combat strength.
When this unit starts the turn below 50% health, it gains a temporary increase to combat strength.
Boost Mod (used)
This bonus has already been used. Return to a city with a Biomod Facility to recharge it.
This bonus has already been used. Return to a city with a Biomod Facility to recharge it.
Boost Mod Bonus 3
30% increase to combat strength.
30% increase to combat strength.
Boost Mod Bonus 2
20% increase to combat strength.
20% increase to combat strength.
Boost Mod Bonus 1
10% increase to combat strength.
10% increase to combat strength.
Stim Mod
When this unit starts the turn below 50% health, it gains +25 HP.
When this unit starts the turn below 50% health, it gains +25 HP.
Stim Mod (used)
This bonus has already been used. Return to a city with a Biomod Facility to recharge it.
This bonus has already been used. Return to a city with a Biomod Facility to recharge it.
Stealth Bomber Evasion
70% chance of evading interception.
70% chance of evading interception.
Suborbital Bomber Evasion
85% chance of evading interception.
85% chance of evading interception.
Drone Fighter

Advances in drone technology and autonomous computer systems lead to the development of advanced drone fighters, capable of handling air superiority roles. One of the major limitations on the development of fighter aircraft was the human element, as there was a limit to how many G stresses a human body could tolerate before failing. An automated fighter had no such restrictions, and thus could perform to the full capability of modern engineering.
The Drone Fighter is a futuristic air unit.
Air Unit designed to dominate the skies and intercept incoming enemy aircraft.
Suborbital Bomber

In an effort to try and push the range and striking power of bombers to their limit, newer generations of bombers were developed capable of travelling high in the atmosphere, just short of actually travelling into orbit. At these altitudes, they were extremely difficult to intercept, and could travel quickly through the thin atmosphere on semi-ballistic trajectories.
The Suborbital Bomber is a futuristic ranged unit.
A long-range Air Unit that rains death from above onto enemy Units and Cities.
Automaton

Since the earliest robots were developed, the concept of a robotic soldier has existed. While some success was had with remote-controlled machines as early as World War Two, it wasn't until the deployment of drone combat vehicles at the end of the 20th century that the concept of an autonomous combat machine began to seem feasible. It would still take more extensive development of cognitive technology for autonomous weapon systems, often termed "automatons", to become practical on the battlefield.
The Automaton is a futuristic infantry unit.
Cheap and powerful futuristic Unit that is stronger in groups. Constructed more quickly in cities with Autoplants and Drone Hives.
Chimera

With the development of gengineering permitting the creation of entirely new organisms to fill various needs, many new chimeras were developed to be utilized in combat environments. With predatorial instincts and engineered abilities allowing them to move quickly, traverse rough terrain, and even adaptive camouflage, these chimeras proved to be terrifying to human military forces.
The Chimera is a futuristic infantry unit.
Fast, cheap Unit of the future that requires no special resources to build.
Bio-Titan

The ultimate product of bioengineering, the Bio-Titan is a massive organism engineered solely for combat. With the increasingly refined development of genetic chimeras and other warforms, some bioengineers decided to see just how powerful a warform could become. Utilizing lessons learned from the genetic cloning of ancient dinosaurs, themselves some of the largest animals to have walked the earth, the Bio-Titan was engineered to be massive. Its skeleton reinforced with nanomaterials grown in biofactories, and its metabolism enhanced by implanted radioisotope generators. It has been further augmented by incorporating organic biogenesis tanks into its body, allowing it to spawn short-lived "genoswarms" when threatened by an enemy. Combined with the attacks by its accompanying swarms, a Bio-Titan can deliver a massive barrage of attacks rivalling that of GDRs, while still possessing the regenerative capabilities of other organic warforms.
The Bio-Titan is a futuristic melee unit.
One of the most powerful end-game units, the Bio-Titan can spawn additional units when enemies are near.
Genoswarm

Many of the original bioengineered chimeras were short-lived, lacking in some of the survival instincts and even necessary organs for prolonged survival. While many of these early warforms were discarded in favor of later, more successful designs, the development of the Bio-Titan caused bioengineers to re-examine these early designs to enable the Bio-Titans to function somewhat as transports or carriers, giving them small support units that could be spawned when the Bio-Titan was under immediate threat. Longevity was not a requirement for these swarms -- in fact, most lack even any gastrointestinal system, surviving solely upon stored energy reserves until they perish. Designed as relentless, short-lived attackers, they need no survival instinct, and have little more than a basic need to make frenzied attacks against their enemies.
The Genoswarm is a futuristic infantry unit.
Fast infantry unit that dies at the end of the turn, causing damage to enemies nearby.
Organic Infantry

Advances in genetic engineering and forced tissue growth lead to increasing developments in the fields of organic composites and implants. Many of these advances were turned towards military ends, used to develop regenerative body armor and combat implants that enhanced the performance of soldiers.
The Organic Infantry is a futuristic infantry unit.
Elite infantry unit of the future that can travel through rough terrain and is stronger in enemy territory.
BioTrooper

Advances in biomodification eventually permitted extensive modifications to the human body, to the point that they barely seemed human anymore. Nowhere was this most apparent than in the development of biomodified soldiers, often called "biotroopers". These soldiers were as fast and durable as infantry wearing powered armor, but with fewer logistical demands, and the capability to regenerate combat damage with relative ease. Biotroopers did tend to cause a certain amount of unease around less heavily modified individuals, however, and typically ended up forming their own insular communities amongst ecocities.
The BioTrooper is a futuristic infantry unit.
Elite infantry unit of the future that can travel through rough terrain and is stronger in enemy territory.
Battlesuit

While powered armor gave human soldiers unparalleled protection and strength, it still relies on a human to operate the suit. Advances in artificial intelligence eventually lead to the ultimate soldier - a robotic unit that could fight equally as well as a human. Although there were a number of concerns about the prospect of fielding large numbers of robotic units with minimal human control, those societies that did so found them to be highly efficient and effective on the battlefield, with fewer issues involved in adapting them back to civilian duties during peacetime.
The Battlesuit is a futuristic infantry unit.
Basic Unit of the future that requires no special resources to build.
Robot Infantry

While powered armor gave human soldiers unparalleled protection and strength, it still relies on a human to operate the suit. Advances in artificial intelligence eventually lead to the ultimate soldier - a robotic unit that could fight equally as well as a human. Although there were a number of concerns about the prospect of fielding large numbers of robotic units with minimal human control, those societies that did so found them to be highly efficient and effective on the battlefield, with fewer issues involved in adapting them back to civilian duties during peacetime.
The Robot Infantry is a futuristic infantry unit.
Powerful futuristic Unit that is stronger in groups. Constructed more quickly in cities with Autoplants and Drone Hives.
Railgun Armor

While conventional tank munitions have continued to improve over the decades, electromotive weapons hold the potential to be even more devastating. Conventional cannons had increasingly adopted sabot rounds to penetrate enemy armor, as these rounds could focus more energy on a smaller area, but railguns could fire rounds with a similarly small surface area even faster. The earliest railguns were mounted upon naval vessels, but advances in power plants and energy systems eventually lead to newer generations of railguns that could be mounted on armored vehicles.
The Railgun Armor is a futuristic armored unit.
Fast and powerful futuristic Unit.
Mech Artillery

While wheeled and tracked vehicles are still the most practical, the concept of a legged combat vehicle has long captured the imagination of engineers and scientists. It was inevitable that experimentation towards making viable legged vehicles would be conducted, with the earliest practical prototypes being multilegged frames. These walkers could traverse some rough terrain that even tracked vehicles couldn't, although most were outfitted with wheeled secondary movement systems to allow them to drive along roads and smooth terrain at higher speeds than they could walk. Their articulated frames had difficulty withstanding the recoil of tank cannons, however, and thus they were typically outfitted with missile systems to avoid any problems. These mechs became useful as artillery platforms, able to fire from locations unreachable by conventional vehicles, confounding efforts to deter them.
The Mech Artillery is a futuristic siege unit.
Powerful siege unit of the future.
Vertol

As the technology behind vertical take-off and landing aircraft matured, an increasing variety of designs began to appear, displacing the standard helicopter gunship. An increasing number of VTOL aircraft utilized jet turbines, but were designed to allow the engines to pivot or otherwise direct their thrust. These aircraft, because of their VTOL capabilities, were often referred to as "vertols" as a shorthand.
The Vertol is a futuristic aerial unit designed to hunt enemy Armor units.
Unit specialized in fighting Modern and Railgun Armor. It is capable of hovering over Mountains, but takes damage if ending its turn on one.
Hovertank

The concept of a tank that could cross any terrain by hovering over it has long been a staple of science fiction. Eventually, however, advances in materials engineering, power plants, and control systems made this a reality. With improved power plants, vertols could be configured to carry enough armor to rival a ground-based tank, and sophisticated expert systems and cybernetic controls permitted their crews to handle the aerodynamically unstable craft. These new units were as fast as older vertols, but as heavily armed and armored as tanks. Often they were configured with missiles with EMP warheads, allowing them to devastate advanced armor units, although they proved to be less successful against infantry utilizing biomodifications.
The Hovertank is a futuristic aerial unit designed to hunt enemy Armor units.
Unit specialized in fighting Railgun Armor and Giant Death Robots. It is capable of hovering over Mountains, but takes damage if ending its turn on one.
Cybersub

Life on board a submarine has always been stressful for its crews, demanding long periods of time spent in extremely confined quarters. As computer systems became more sophisticated, it was a natural conclusion to try and automate as many of the processes on board submarines, to reduce the number of crew required. Advanced in nanomaterials also permitted a new generation of submarine hulls and torpedo weapons that could move faster and hit targets further away. The extensive automation and computer-assisted controls lead to this new generation of submarines being termed "cybersubs".
The Cybersub is a futuristic submarine.

Invisible to all Units except Destroyers, Missile Cruisers, Arsenal Ships, and other Submarines, or until it attacks or is adjacent to another unit. Can carry two Missiles, and is specialized in attacking Naval Units.
Missile Destroyer

With the development of guided missiles as a method of naval and shore bombardment, navies began to experiment with various platforms to carry and launch them from. The Soviet Union favored larger guided missile cruisers which would carry a large number of missiles to perform saturation attacks, using them as the core for their combat groups. The United States, on the other hand, utilized carriers as the core for their combat groups, and thus outfitted destroyer hulls with guided missiles to act as escorts.
The Missile Destroyer is a futuristic version of the Destroyer.
Fast futuristic ship making it highly effective at recon. Also used to hunt down and destroy enemy Submarines. Fights as a naval melee unit.
Advanced Destroyer

Ever since their development, destroyers have been an indispensable part of modern navies. With their high speed and sensor suites, they could serve as a first line of defense, spotting hostile ships and submarines. Advanced in materials engineering and sensor technology have lead to continuous upgrades in their design, however. Particularly with the advent of stealth technology and computer systems to enhance the effectiveness of sensor systems, these new, advanced destroyers have become an even more essential part of the navy.
The Advanced Destroyer is a futuristic version of the Destroyer.
Fast futuristic ship making it highly effective at recon. Also used to hunt down and destroy enemy Submarines. Fights as a naval melee unit.
Arsenal Ship

An arsenal ship is a concept for a floating missile platform intended to have as many as five hundred vertical launch bays for mid-sized missiles, most likely cruise missiles. In some naval doctrines, arsenal ships would be commanded remotely by another ship, although as computer systems became more sophisticated some were converted to become largely autonomous.
The Arsenal Ship is a futuristic successor to the Missile Cruiser. It can carry four Missile units, as well as having its own powerful ranged attack.
The Arsenal Ship is a futuristic successor to the Missile Cruiser. It can carry four Missile units, as well as having its own powerful ranged attack.
Supercarrier
Carries up to 4 Aircraft.

The Supercarrier is a specialized vessel which carries fighter airplanes, bombers (but not stealth bombers), and atomic bombs. While the Supercarrier cannot directly attack, the aircraft it carries makes it the most powerful offensive weapon afloat. Defensively, while the Supercarrier can defend itself from both close range surface and long range air attacks, the Supercarrier is still weak and should be escorted by Missile Destroyers and Nuclear Submarines.
The Supercarrier is the nuclear age evolution of the Aircraft Carrier.
Drone UAV

Unmanned aerial vehicles were used as early as 1964, during the Vietnam War, but did not enter widespread use until the necessary technologies matured towards the end of the 20th century. While initially used in a primarily reconnaissance role in environments too hazardous to risk human pilots in, armed UAVs became increasingly prevalent as a means of delivering precision strikes at long range without needing an expensive manned aircraft.
The Drone UAV is a modern ranged combat unit.
A modern recon and ranged unit
Hybrid Drone

The advances made in biocomputers and organic composites lead to experimentation in incorporating biological components into existing unmanned units. Termed "hybrid drones", the organic components of these units made it easier to repair and sustain them in the field, due to the regenerative technologies that had been developed for certain infantry units. One unusual side effect was that the drones seemed to develop almost animalistic impulses, become particularly predatory towards hostile aircraft, particularly slower-moving vertols and hovertanks.
The Hybrid Drone is a futuristic ranged combat unit.
The most powerful ranged combat unit.
Biodrone

The advances made in biocomputers and organic composites lead to experimentation in incorporating biological components into existing unmanned units. Termed "hybrid drones", the organic components of these units made it easier to repair and sustain them in the field, due to the regenerative technologies that had been developed for certain infantry units. One unusual side effect was that the drones seemed to develop almost animalistic impulses, become particularly predatory towards hostile aircraft, particularly slower-moving vertols and hovertanks.
The Hybrid Drone is a futuristic ranged combat unit.
The most powerful ranged combat unit.
Hypervelocity Missile

Improvements in nanomaterials engineering and propulsion technologies lead to a leap forwards in the design of guided missiles. Utilizing ramjet engines with extra-lightweight frames, this new generation of missiles was capable of reaching hypersonic speeds, allowing them to strike from further away before a response could be made.
The Hypervelocity Missile is a futuristic version of the Guided Missile.
A one-shot Unit that may be used once to damage enemy Units or Cities.
Crawler

As Mech Artillery became increasingly predominant, certain logistical issues began to crop up, as Mech Artillery units could travel to locations where resupply was difficult with conventional logistics methods. At the same time, advances in materials engineering and compact fusion power plants lead to the concept of superheavy vehicles. While this was found most notably in combat units such as the GDR, one unconventional solution to the logistical issues facing artillery units was the Crawler, a gigantic mobile factory and munitions plant. Capable of consuming local resources, converting them into useful raw materials, and then processing those materials into munitions, the first Crawlers were deployed as logistical support to Mech Artillery battalions. The Crawlers themselves were vulnerable to attack from highly mobile units such as Hovertanks, however, and thus were soon armed with their own defensive missile batteries, capable of using the munitions they manufactured in their own defense. As these weapons were more properly integrated into the Crawler design, however, some designers began to wonder why the Crawlers should be kept in a supporting role, when they could be easily converted into viable, self-sustaining artillery vehicles in their own right. Thus, the Crawler eventually became the ultimate artillery weapon -- a long range missile platform that could resupply itself in the field.
The Crawler is a siege unit that can carry three Missile units. It may manufacture one Hypervelocity Missile each turn if it has less than three.
Siege unit that can carry three Missile units. Has a 33% chance of manufacturing one Missile unit each turn if carrying less than three.
Nanohive

The development of nanomachines, particularly nanoassemblers and nanodisassemblers, inevitably resulted in a search to weaponize these devices and utilize them for military purposes. While some success was had with short-lived nanoswarms delivered as missile payloads, most nanoswarms had difficulty surviving extended periods in battlefield conditions. Eventually, the idea of using autonomous carriers, termed "nanohives", to deliver swarms of nanomachines to the battlefield was conceived. Using sophisticated low-altitude hovering technology, these nanohives were able to traverse nearly any terrain to bring nanoswarms to the front. With proper programming, nanoswarms could be assigned to both heal friendly units, as well as attack enemy units, slowly but inexorably dissolving targets away as they were disassembled on a molecular level.
The Nanohive is a futuristic unit that heals friendly units while damaging enemy units within two tiles of it each turn.
The Nanohive is a futuristic unit that heals friendly units while damaging enemy units within two tiles of it each turn.
Nexus

The ultimate expression of cybernetic warfare, the Nexus is an advanced command and support platform designed to provide support to units in the field. Utilizing the latest advancements in smart materials and power plants, the Nexus is actually a flying fortress, utilizing sophisticated engines to keep it constantly hovering in the air. This gives it unparalleled mobility, allowing it to support units wherever it is necessary. It carries onboard nanohives to provide immediate repairs and healing to damaged units, as well as a centralized command node that constantly analyzes the immediate battlespace, in order to provide up-to-the-second updates to nearby troops, allowing them to prepare for any enemy attacks or exploit enemy weaknesses. It also carries a battery of railguns and missiles for tactical support, and many have been configured to also carry drone aircraft to provide fire support over greater distances.
The Nanohive is a futuristic unit that heals friendly units while damaging enemy units adjacent to it each turn.
Futuristic support unit that heals friendly units while damaging enemy units adjacent to it each turn, and can carry up to 4 Aircraft.
Special Forces
Late-game Infantry unit designed for rapid, powerful amphibious attacks.

Special Forces are an Information-Era upgrade for the Marine. Slightly weaker than Mechanized Infantry, it gains a large boost to movement when moving through Coast tiles, is stronger while embarked, and receives a 20% Combat Bonus when attacking from Coast. However, it gains no defensive bonuses from terrain, so stay on the move!

Special Forces, or Special Operations Forces, are military units trained to preform unconventional missions. The elite of the elite, these units specialize in many fields, including amphibious assaults, airborne operations, counter-terrorism, espionage, sabotage, assassination, rescue, and all-around unconventional warfare. Special Forces, as they would now be recognized, emerged in the 20th century, with the outbreak of the Second World War. In 1940, the British Commandos were formed after prime minister Winston Churchill called for "specially trained troops of the hunter class, who can develop a reign of terror down the enemy coast." Today, almost a necessity for any civilization seeking military power, these units have changed wildly over the years. They've adapted and continue to adapt to the ever-changing face of warfare, proving their worth more than ever.
Airborne Forces
Strong infantry Unit capable of paradropping up to 5 tiles from friendly territory. Paratrooper can also move and pillage after paradropping, but cannot enter combat until the following turn.

The Paratrooper is a late-game infantryman. It is about as strong mechanized infantry unit; however, it can parachute up to 5 tiles away (when starting in friendly territory). This allows the airborne forces to literally jump over enemy positions and destroy road networks, pillage vital resources and so forth, wrecking havoc behind his lines. The Airborne Forces are at great risk when on such missions, so make sure the target is worth it!

Airborne forces are military units, usually light infantry, set up to be moved by aircraft and "dropped" into battle, typically by parachute. Thus, they can be placed behind enemy lines, and have the capability to deploy almost anywhere with little warning. The formations are limited only by the number and size of their aircraft, so given enough capacity a huge force can appear "out of nowhere" in minutes, an action referred to as vertical envelopment.
Tyrannosaurus Rex

One of the most iconic of the dinosaurs, it was inevitable that efforts would be made to resurrect the Tyrannosaurus Rex. Benefiting from genetic manipulation, the Tyrannosaurus Rex of Jurassic Park is powerful and fast, but its strength has made it difficult to deal with any animals that escape.
A dinosaur unit that escaped from Jurassic Park.
A dinosaur unit that escaped from Jurassic Park.
Triceratops

An iconic plant-eating dinosaur, the Triceratops is slow-moving, but its hide and bony plates give it immense protection. Some animals have escaped from their captivity, and have required anti-tank weapons to be brought down.
A dinosaur unit that escaped from Jurassic Park.
A dinosaur unit that escaped from Jurassic Park.
Velociraptor

One of the most frightening of the genetically re-engineered dinosaurs of Jurassic Park, Velociraptors are quite intelligent and frequently try to find ways to escape captivity. While not as strong as the T-Rex and not as tough as a Triceratops, they are extremely fast and can be difficult to hunt down once they've escaped.
A dinosaur unit that escaped from Jurassic Park.
A dinosaur unit that escaped from Jurassic Park.
